description: List all items for a conversation with the given ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the conversation to list items for.
parameters.name: conversation_id

parameters.description:
A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between
1 and 100, and the default is 20.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The order to return the input items in. Default is `desc`.
- `asc`: Return the input items in ascending order.
- `desc`: Return the input items in descending order.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: An item ID to list items after, used in pagination.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
- `web_search_call.action.sources`: Include the sources of the web search tool call.
- `code_interpreter_call.outputs`: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `message.output_text.logprobs`: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
- `reasoning.encrypted_content`: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the `store` parameter is set to `false`, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).
parameters.name: include

items.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
- `web_search_call.action.sources`: Include the sources of the web search tool call.
- `code_interpreter_call.outputs`: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `message.output_text.logprobs`: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
- `reasoning.encrypted_content`: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the `store` parameter is set to `false`, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).

anyOf.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the
[file search guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

anyOf.description: The results of the file search tool call.

Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. Keys are strings
with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum
length of 512 characters, booleans, or numbers.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`,
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

anyOf.title: File search tool call

items.description: A source used in the search.

type.description: The type of source. Always `url`.

items.title: Web search source

sources.title: Web search sources

type.description: The action type.

url.description: The URL opened by the model.

url.description: The URL of the page searched for the pattern.

An object describing the specific action taken in this web search call.
Includes details on how the model used the web (search, open_page, find).

A click action.

button.description: Indicates which mouse button was pressed during the click. One of `left`, `right`, `wheel`, `back`, or `forward`.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the click occurred.

anyOf.description: A drag action.

path.description:
An array of coordinates representing the path of the drag action. Coordinates will appear as an array
of objects, eg
```
[
  { x: 100, y: 200 },
  { x: 200, y: 300 }
]
```

items.description: An x/y coordinate pair, e.g. `{ x: 100, y: 200 }`.
items.title: Coordinate

type.description:
Specifies the event type. For a drag action, this property is 
always set to `drag`.

anyOf.title: Drag

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is always set to `keypress`.

anyOf.title: KeyPress
